Consumer Protection

Consumer Rights

What to know about consumer protection laws and your rights

Your Rights

5 rights in this scenario

Debt collectors cannot harass you, lie about what you owe, call before 8 AM or after 9 PM, or contact you at work if your employer prohibits it. They cannot threaten jail, garnishment, or arrest if it's not legal. If a debt collector violates these rules, you can sue them for damages. Request written verification of any debt.

ðŸ’¡ This right has state-specific variations. Select a state to see relevant details.

Source: Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA) of 1977

Within 30 days of receiving a debt collector's first letter, you can send a written dispute demanding they prove the debt is valid. They must then provide verification or stop collection efforts. Many debts are unverifiable or belong to someone else. Send disputes by certified mail with return receipt.

Source: Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA) Â§ 809

If you buy something through a door-to-door sale, telemarketing, or certain other methods, you have 3 business days to cancel and get your money back, no questions asked. The seller must provide written cancellation instructions. This applies even if you agreed to the purchase. Put cancellation in writing.

Source: Federal Trade Commission (FTC) Cooling-Off Rule (16 CFR Â§ 429)

Lenders must clearly disclose the loan terms, annual percentage rate (APR), finance charges, payment amount, and total amount you'll pay back. All terms must be in writing before you sign. Misleading disclosure of rates or fees is illegal. Compare APRs and terms before committing to a loan.

ðŸ’¡ This right has state-specific variations. Select a state to see relevant details.

Source: Truth in Lending Act (TILA) of 1968

If your new vehicle has persistent defects that make it unsafe or unfit for its basic purpose, the manufacturer may be required to replace it or refund your money. Each state has specific rules and timeframes. Defects must be reported and given a chance to be fixed. Documentation of repair attempts is crucial.

ðŸ’¡ This right has state-specific variations. Select a state to see relevant details.

Source: State Lemon Laws (varies by state; federal Magnuson-Moss Warranty Act also applies)
